Reviews.Title: “Avg New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandi Y
Reviews.Content: Nearby Local Supermarket at very good price, But No Free Wifi ><" avg stay. Went with the tour. Very limited selection of the Brkfast

Reviews.Title: “One of the best basic hotels I have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: TurnerJP
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at for any reason - business or personal. Rooms are a little basic but they're clean, comfortable and functional. Good TV and wifi is available in all rooms. Food is great (taste & value) and the chef is willing to discuss his cooking with you, if you're interested :-) The waiters and reception staff are always willing to assist and welcome you with a smile. This is an incredibly friendly hotel and great value, too. It is also close to the Anagnina shopping centre and has plenty of parking available. I have stayed here twice, each time for a week, and have thoroughly enjoyed both my visits.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Cestovatel_W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely outside the city, close to IKEA and Ciampino airport. So if you don't have a car, don't stay there. If you have it, be ready to spend up to 1-2 hr getting the city centre (depends on the traffic, serious jams during morning and evening hours). The hotel itself is very basic, most of guests are huge tourists bus groups from the East. Rooms are basic as well, no even minibar (there is, but empty), but beds are very comfortable for sleeping. Breakfast could be fine, but it's not well maintained, so out's by chance, you could find good offering or you can come in wring moment and find nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Telmo A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and is located in a shopping area. the rooms are nice and comfortable and the bathrooms are very clean. the biggest problem is the breakfast, there is variety of food but this is rarely replaced, so the guests have to wait for food. the bread and pastry are are not fresh (industrial anda packed) and the fruit is canned. The hotel is near the Anagnina metro station , but it is impossible to walk to the station because there is an freeay between the hotel and the sation. You have to take a bus. Metro takes about 20 minutes to central Rome. This is a good hotel if you want a hotel with an accessible price and if you do not mind being away from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Rome short stay and Metro access.”
Reviews.Author: daveion
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for just 2 nights and found it's location perfect for our needs. We wanted to be close to Anagnina Metro and Ciapino Airport following which we were driving down to Sorrento. The Hotel is a recent build integrated within a Retail Park facility. The Hotel facilities were modern, very clean, helpful staff, reliable shuttle to and from Anagnina Metro, breakfast was a buffet and well provided for with breads, cakes, fruit, cereal, cold meats and cheese. I think it's a great place to be if you just want a place to rest following a long day in Rome. It was very reasonable at £112 for 2 nights and as said, great for our needs but would not recommend for long stays and is clearly not within any walking distance of anything but the attached Retail Park.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in outer suburb!”
Reviews.Author: L4ZY_80Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears to be really new and the rooms and hallways look really nice and trendy. All the room doors on the hall side have an enlarged scene from a classic movie or a classic actor. The rooms are really spacious with tile flooring, making the place really look and feel clean. The bedding was a nice and comfortable queen bed. Although i did book a twin room for my sister and i, but we didn't bother changing rooms after we informed reception. Don't except any views or anything but this is to be expected for the affordable pricing of the hotel and the location of the hotel. The buffet breakfast was very nice with a wide selection of food including hot and cold food. The hotel is located in the Anagnina region which is about a 20 minute metro ride from Termini station. The downside is though that the metro is only running until 9pm and the public buses that go to the hotel (2min bus ride) don't run after 9pm or there abouts. The hotel does have it's own shuttle bus service, however the times are quite limited. I mention that the bus ride is a short 2 minutes from Anagnina metro station, sad thing is that you cannot walk from the metro as there is a highway in between and there is absolutely no way to get to the other side (i tried a couple of times). So if you arrive to Rome late at night there is a bus service from Termini that will take you to Anagnina and then you will need to take a taxi from there which will put you out of pocket by about 10euros. Hotel is also in close proximity to Ciampino airport and has a shuttle service there too. Staff at the hotel were nice and more often than not had a smile on their face. Would definitely recommend this hotel for people who wish to save some money and not stay in the hustle and bustle of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, shame about the Whacky Races outside.”
Reviews.Author: Adeyave
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the room when we checked in, it really is a lovely modern hotel for the price and although the location is not ideal, the shuttle bus to the airport is only 10 euros per room. We could find only kebab vans and McDonalds close by to eat, as we had arrived too late to eat in the hotel, but the continental breakfast was adequate. The PROBLEM is the car race on the street and carpark outside. Hundreds of people lined the streets to watch from 10pm until the early hours of the morning. Speeding cars and bikes drove round and round, skidding and spinning their wheels.When the really noisy souped up cars cars arrived after midnight, the crowd cheered and clapped for them. Not sure if this occurs every night or if the noise is as bad at the rear of the hotel, but please check before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable customer service!”
Reviews.Author: MariaBham
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel as the service we received was unacceptable. We had booked 2 rooms for 3 nights through an online booking site and few days previous to arrival I sent the hotel an email asking them to confirm the booking and to inform them we would arrive late at night. They never bothered to reply. On the day we were due to check in I rang them to tell them what time we would arrive in Rome. Then I am told that there is a problem and they don’t have rooms for us! It was very obvious they had over-booked and decided to book us out to another hotel in the same chain. This was located much further from the airport and I had chosen this hotel as it would be close to the airport and cheap to take a taxi as we arrived in the middle of the night. Now we ended up paying 3 times more for the taxi! Arriving at the other hotel no-one at reception even seemed to take notice. When we finally get to check-in we have to wait for about 20 minutes and when I ask them what the problem is they tell us they are fully booked! All this time they were very arrogant towards us, never apologized for the inconvenience they caused, nothing! For the following to nights we had to go back to the hotel we booked originally, and first they wanted us to go there by the metro. I said we won’t accept that as we have luggage and this wasn’t our fault but theirs, so they arranged a shuttle for us. I was very upset as we only had 2 days to spend in Rome and now ended up wasting half a day to move hotels! We never received any sort of compensation or any apologies from anyone. I also had problems with the room as there was something wrong with the AC that made an awful lot of noise (even when turned off) so it was impossible to sleep in the room. When I complained about this I wasn’t taken seriously and the receptionist suggested I open the window a bit (!) like that would solve the problem. Eventually maintenance came and sorted it for me. The hotel looks nice on the photos as they have refurbished the reception and public areas but the rooms are a bit old and especially the bathrooms. Not 4 star standards. Breakfast was also very poor if you are used to continental or hot. I am in the hotel business myself and if this hotel is nothing close to a 4 star. I am still upset by the horrible customer service, and having travelled all over the world this is my worst hotel experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “stay away!!”
Reviews.Author: liebe54
Reviews.Content: The service is terrible, actually no service at all, the location is very bad, far away from city center, only close to airport, restaurant only for breakfast,, very small, many people including groups, not enough food. If something is wrong in the room, do not expact that it will be fixed!! many phones in rooms doesnot work, its always:tomorrow will be fixwd", but they never fix it. in reception some of the receptionists try to be polite, but their english is terrible!! This is not a way to welcome tourists!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Ciampino - and that's all”
Reviews.Author: Ian110466
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the return leg of a trip to the Cilentan coast. We flew to & from Ciampino and stayed here for the last night before our flight home. It was cheap at £70 excl Rome City tax and convenient for the airport, but theyre the only redeeming features. The room was comfortable, but no better than that. The location is odd - a small shopping mall and an Ikea nearby but thats all. There was 1 local pizzeria about 10 mins walk away but it seemed a bit grotty so we opted for the only other option - a new place called Salotto Culinario which turned out to be fantastic. We were so impressed that I have reviewed it separately. Walking back to the hotel, very well-fed and watered and looking forward to a good night's sleep, imagine our horror when we found some kind of boy racer rally in the car park. They were literally racing around the hotel and we had to run across the "track" to get to the lobby. There were hotdog stalls etc so it's clearly a regular, organised event. The roaring of boy racer exhausts and screeching tyres went on until after 2am so we were far from refreshed when we got up at 7 for breakfast, which was decidedly average. The free shuttle bus took us to Ciampino, taking about 15 mins. There is no way we would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but very noisy during weekend”
Reviews.Author: wescbr
Reviews.Content: Our travel agency booked this hotel for our entire tour group, the hotel is relatively new ( renovated I believe because some room has updated modern bathroom layout while some have very old tiles and toilets). The hotel is packed with group tourist so check-in can be hectic. We checked-in on a Friday night and there was only a lady working out there alone around 8:30pm. The biggest problem is that the hotel is within a shopping mall complex, which is normally fine but on a Friday night, the parking lot turns into the illegal racing hotspot for all the pimped-out rides. We were first okay with it because the drivers and audiences were just doing their things without disturbing tourists. However, because the air conditioning dont work in our room we had to open the window which means we heard the tire-screeching sound for whole night. Luckily police came and the crowd dispersed, however they came back until someone got into accident. You can fulfill some shopping needs there, and there is a McDonald's around the corner open 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find and nowhere to eat”
Reviews.Author: Trishku
Reviews.Content: The hotel was difficult to find using public transport. The room was confortable and clean. Unfortunately the airconditioning was not working. The staff did try to get it going. There is no restaurant in the hotel or nearby. We had to eat in the IKEA cafe it was the only option if you did not want to go into the city centre. The worst aspect of our stay was the race track in the carpark outside racing cars at midnight and until 1.30 in the morning was unacceptable - we complained to the staff and they told us that the police had been called - the police did arrive but as soon as they left the racing and music started again. The race eventually broke up when there was a car crash - the police returned and at last we were able to get some sleep. The airport shuttle bus was on time and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: PK173
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on a business trip. Initial impressions were not favourable - arrived hungry at 20:00 on a Sunday only to discover there is no restaurant. The receptionist directed me to a restaurant just 5 mins walk away which was great, so a good save! The room was clean and well equipped but horribly warm. Seems that the central AC had not been turned on so I could only move the warm air around. Breakfast was reasonable. This is primarily a business hotel. It is in the middle of a business district. There is a shopping arcade in the same block and a monster Ikea across the road. Central Rome is half an hour away by car. Room rate was 80€ per night

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay very much”
Reviews.Author: SamasamaMalaysia
Reviews.Content: We were with a tour group and extended our stay in Rome at this hotel. The hotel was in a shopping centre with a big supermarket. So shopping, food, etc was readily available. Room was big , clean and modern. Breakfast was great. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful and gave us all the information, including a tourist map. Transport was easy and readily availbale and took 20-30 mins to Rome by bus and Metro for 1 Euro one-way. Bus stop was at the front of the hotel. Only one stop by bus to the Metro and two stops on return. Taxi to FCO airport is available via the reception at a fixed rate of 55 Euro. As it was the centre of one of the greatest civilisation in the world and centre of a religious faith, it was worth it by staying longer in Rome. There were lots of history, culture and food. Very easy to get around in Rome. The Sistine Chapel is a must see. The original paintings of many of the world's greatest artists are there. We did not take the tourist bus as Rome was quite a small city and the Metro coverage and a bit of walking for sight seeing was all that was required to leisurely cover the city. People were friendly and nice. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, breakfast and service good, location not bad”
Reviews.Author: Vassnat
Reviews.Content: Found by chance on outskirts of Rome, thsi is a ncie modern clean hotel. The staff were very helpful, spoke great English, looked after our bags whilst we went to Rome for the day and showed us where to pay the €6 for all day parking, bargain we thought. Breakfast was great, large buffet, room more than sufficient, bit small but modern and clean. It is a way out of Rome but not at all inconvenient as you are one bus stop to the metro, metro reasonable price and bus was free. Remember to catch bus on other side of road from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is far away from Rome”
Reviews.Author: SuViseu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 25 minutes by metro from Rome and then you have to take a bus to get to the hotel, it is awful to get there. The metro to this station stops at around 9 pm. I hated my stay here because it felt like I was isolated from the rest of the world. The lady that was there when I checked in wasn´t very friendly and didn´t even point the way to the elevators. The pay movies were oldies like Grease, Footloose, Airplane...You also have to pay for internet acess. I do not recomend this hotel. Stay in Rome and pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Ciampino Airport”
Reviews.Author: StPaulus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Anagnina at the beginning and the end of our trip to Italy. We chose the hotel based on its proximity to Ciampino airport for a late-evening arrival and an early morning departure. Upon arrival at Ciampino, we took the bus to the Anagnina Metro station (1.20 Euro). From there we walked to the hotel, which I would not really recommend for everyone, as you have to cross the entrance and exit ramps of a major highway. There are several buses you can use instead. Check-in was fairly quick and efficient. Carpets in the hallways could certainly use a good cleaning, but the room itself was spacious, adequately furnished and generally in good condition and clean. The breakfast buffet was included in our rate and was above average. For dinner we walked to nearby “Juan de Marco”, a popular restaurant: not too cheap, but the food was excellent. Wired Internet access is available for a moderate fee, and the McDonald’s next door has free WLAN access. If you travel by car, parking is available for free in the underground garage of the shopping center (open from 8 am to 9:30 pm), or in front of the hotel after 7 pm. It takes about 10-20 minutes to get to the airport depending on traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Breakfast and First Class Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: senza210
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the very last stop on the Rome Metro Line A. That is about a 30-40 minute ride each way, so not convenient to Rome downtown; however, I saved money and felt lik I was in a 3.5-4 star hotel vs a 1-2 star for the same cost closer to the city. It was safe and easy to navigate once I had been there a day. My first night it was late and difficult to find. I followed directions form the internet and they were incorrect. I left a bus stop thinking it was right there and it wasnt. My first night in a foreign country and not speaking italian, it was scary. I was lucky and found an older couple whom offered a drive me. I normally would never do that but had no choice and they knew the hotel and reminded me of my parents so I accepted it. It was a few minutes away by car so I had been closer than I thought. The next two days I was able to navigate really easily to the hotel by bus to the train and walking..... Its a beatiful hotel and the breakfast was unbeatable. fresh fruit, breads, cheeses, eggs, and different type of fresh squeezed juices. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Not that great with English but enough to assist me when I had questions. The rooms are neat and clean and nicely furnished with a king size bed for a single size price. I was very happy with my choice and recommend the hotel if the location doesnt bother you. If I had to go back, I would stay closer, but its okay if you trying to save a little and get nice accommodations. Just make sure you know how to get there upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location OK”
Reviews.Author: DiazFamilyCali
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Anagnina Hotel was comfortable. I got a great deal at about 70 euros a night. The hotel is modern and my room was very spacious compared to other hotels I have stayed in while in Rome. My room was also clean and quiet. The hotel is connected to a shopping mall, complete with a McDonalds and a supermarket. (Tip: Stock up on water from the supermarket or be willing to pay 4 - 5 euros for water in the center of Rome). The major issue with this hotel is the distance from the city. It will take a bus ride to the Metro (5 minutes) and another 30 - 40 minutes on the Metro to get to Termini Station. It was not really a problem for me as I stopped at Punto Longo station every day to meet up with my traveling companions. The least expensive way to get to this hotel from FCO airport is by taking the Leonardo Express Train from FCO to Termini station (11 Euros and 30 minutes). Once at Termini, get a metro pass and take the A line towards Anagnina. Get off at Anagnina (last stop) and walk to the bus terminal. Take the 46 , 506 or 507 bus and get off when you see the hotel (first stop, look for the Ikea). Overall this hotel was a good deal and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: criddymonkey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days while travelling through Europe last summer. The hotel is far from the city center, so it is quiet there. However, you have to take a bus to the subway station and then ride the trains for a while before you reach any tourist attractions. The mall attached to the hotel isn't anything to brag about, and there really aren't any places nearby to eat. But the hotel was clean, and our room was spacious. It's a good value for the money as long as you don't mind being away from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we have ever been.”
Reviews.Author: Lina80
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3-night stay at the end march at Ananigna Hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel and our room, we found out that the air-conditioning system operates only for cooling, but not warming function despite the cold weather at night there. We had just one blanket in our room so we asked for additional one…But that was just the top of the iceberg! At every 2-3 hours their alarm system in the corridor beeped for some minutes to make sure that we do not have any chance of falling asleep. Other guests on the same floor had complained about the alarm too and the manager also acknowledged the problem and told us that he arranged technicians to fix it. The “nice” surprises continued. To keep us a company while being awake at night there was a MOUSE in our room!!! I saw it when it ran across the room when I switched on the lighting after hearing some weird noises. And this is a hotel that claims for 4 STARS?! The hotel looks nice on the outside but it is its only advantage! It really ruined our vacation and I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: bazzaman1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend for 3 nights.We arrived late at night and there was no problem.The hotel is a modern looking hotel and modern on the inside.The reception area,bar and restaurant are all joined together.The room was modern and spacious with sat tv etc.very nice room with wooden floor.The breakfast was very good with a good choice of everything.The hotel itself is a good distance from centre of Rome.Metro is the best way to reach centre.The nearest metro station to the hotel is 5 mins by bus.The bus stop is right across the road from the hotel.Would be adevised to walk to metro station because there is no pathway along a busy road(dual carriageway).very dangerous,so bus is only option.20-25 mins to centre of rome by metro...alot of stops.late at night it is very hard to get a bus back from metro station to hotel.The Bar in the hotel iss virtually non existant.Hotel located right beside a large shopping centre.Overall this a decent hotel,very clean,modern,cheap and the centre of Rome is easily accessable.Only down side is that the metro station is a bit far away from hotel..buses area small bit inconsistant.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Ciampino Airport”
Reviews.Author: CHerPig
Reviews.Content: Hotel Anagnina provides a nice, clean room that is convenient to Rome's smaller, Ciampino Airport. BE AWARE that you must take a bus or taxi from Rome's Anagnina Metro stop to the actual Anagnina Hotel. Hotel Anagnina is NOT WALKING DISTANCE FROM THE METRO!! The Anagnina front desk personnel-especially, Mr. Herman William-are very efficient and speak several languages, fluently. Breakfast buffet was GREAT-included several fresh fruits, breads, and hot dishes. Best of all...Hotel Anagnina provided a FREE shuttle to Airport Ciampino--about a 10 minute ride from hotel. The shuttle is available upon request. We showed our appreciation to the driver with a nice tip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: racingqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Anagnina for 4 nights in May. We took a taxi from Ciampino airport which is only 10 mins away, the driver said it would be 30 euros but we haggled him down to 20 euros before getting in! The hotel is spotless, large rooms, nice bathrooms, fridge and free safe in the rooms. The buffet breakfast was great, an extensive choice of hot and cold food. The shopping mall adjacent is ok. Make sure you eat in Rome before returning to the hotel as there is no restaurant at the hotel and only a small cafe bar in the mall. Ikea has a good cafe and is open until 10pm. We found Anagnina metro station very run down and not the type of place to be after dark. We always made sure we were back at the hotel by around 9pm. The metro into the centre of Rome only costs 1 Euro. There are frequent buses from the metro to the hotel, which is only 1 stop away but not very accessible by foot. Ask at reception to book the courtesy bus back to Ciampino airport (they do not advertise this). If you are looking for a comfortable and clean hotel at a good price and do not mind being in a commercial area and travelling 30 mins by metro into Rome then I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: slinkygoers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Anagnina hotel for 3 nights. The rooms were spacious & very clean, the staff friendly & helpful and there was everything you could possibly want for breakfast. The location was good as it is fairly close to the airport but just a metro ride from Rome city. (buses to the metro station pick up from opposite the hotel every few minutes) We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: TravelForFunAndWork
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel three nights in December 2005. The hotel is OK. Very clean rooms of larger than average size. Rate was OK as well. Easily reachable from Ciampino Airport by bus for 1 Euro. There is a supermarket in the mall right behind the hotel and an IKEA right behind that (if you fancy hot dogs). Breakfast was much more choice than most Rome hotels. Full buffet breakfast that enables you to skip lunch :-). The hotel is rather far away from the city center on the ring road, however the center is easily - and cheaply - reached on Metro A. Be aware that the metro stops to run early currently (Around 9 o'clock) until January 10 2006. On the downside, the beds had a tendency to slide across the laminate floor, which could get on your nerves and since it is near to major roads it is not particularly quiet. But if you can live with that it is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Booked by a free web Hotel Reservation system”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We also booked Hotel Anagnina by an Hotel Reservation system RoomsAccomodation , we found there better rate than other web site as venere or nycerome. Rate are about 20 % less than the other !!! Brilliant, Marvellouse. The Location it's ok , south, south west by car or metro you'll be everywhere in few minutes ! We used the Ikea bus service from Anagnina stationj to the Hotel ! Free and fast service! Perfect. The hotel is new, located in a mall with a big supermarket. All staff speak good English. Value: 4 star hotel with 2 star price. Thank to the anagnina staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, located in a mall with a big supermarket and 2 cafeterias (1 small and 1 very big). All staff speak good English. Breakfast has over 30 items. Less than 30 mins. to train terminal with 1 stop bus ride acrross street to Metro A line terminal. (Any one of the 5 bus lines). 4 star hotel with 2 star price.

HotelInfo.Name: Idea Hotel Roma Cinecitta
HotelInfo.Address: Via Torre di Mezzavia 25, 00173 Rome, Italy (Formerly Anagnina Hotel)
